column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"The only issue wity methylphenidate is increased anxiety. Despite having depression related to anxiety
column3: I still advocate 100% for this drug. It saved my life. I just wish doctors would see it for what it is - my PCP views it as a dangerous drug that is only for recreational use when not used for ADHD. However my psychiatrist prescribed me Concerta 36mg (switched to methylphenidate SR due to financial reasons) and I haven't been happier. My anxiety is only worse when I'm not productive. But this medication allows me to be. It allows me to get out of bed in the morning. It allows me to shower and get dressed and clean my house. Of the 7 antidepressants I have been on in the past 2 years none have had such a profound effect.

column1: I truly hope more research is done so that people like myself are able to access the medication they need
column2: despite it being off-label. I have no desire to abuse this drug when it has given me my life back. "

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$"I am suffering from bipolar 2 (or 3) disorder with predominantly severe atypical depressive episodes. I.e. most of the time I suffer from lack of energy as the most important symptom

column8: that brought me many times high success in education and job.

column1: It is very helpful and effective in the treatment of my predominant symptoms of fatigue/neurasthenia and helps very good for me to get work effectively done. I have take care of dosage as my brain is different sensitive to Ritalin from time to time. There is a dependency one can handle by slow down-tapering from time to time. I take it half a year now. column2: as in a dose dependent manner
column3: it is possible that I suffer from acoustical hallucinations (hearing voices) that only can be treated by diazepam effectively (no antipsychotic works here).

453$Depression$10/27/2010 6:47:04 PM$Reviewer: Josh, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with severe treatment resistant depression, as well as social anxiety. I tried lots of different meds but none worked well. I finally started a combination of Trazadone and Welbutrin, while this helped some I still felt that something was missing, still felt lethargic, and still working on the depression. Worst of all the Welbutrin caused me to become mentally unfocused, and my mind was wandering constantly. It was, however the only drug that had helped me at all. I then was prescribed Ritalin in addition to those. Wow is it exactly what I had needed. I have been able  to keep my focus, able to have enough energy to get through a standard day and not want to hide from the world. For the first time, I have actually been feeling good. I honestly feel like I have found a miracle combination for what was troubling me. I have noticed no negative side effects. the only down side is that after about 6 hrs or so of taking it I begin to feel a slow down, or crash. As if I hadnt taken it at all. I intend to see if I can spread it out through the day. but other than that it really has been fantastic for me.
